channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The race to find new materials with AI needs more data. Meta is giving massive amounts away for free.
item.description: Meta is releasing a massive data set and models, called Open Materials 2024, that could help scientists use AI to discover new materials much faster. ...

item.title: ChatGPT’s Canvas now shows tracked changes
item.description: OpenAI now lets some ChatGPT users check changes to text or code on the Canvas feature, something developers have been asking for.

item.title: U.S. exceptionalism is now driving markets — if only this jinx can be avoided
item.description: Markets increasingly as pricing in a scenario of U.S. exceptionalism.

item.title: Why AI is going nuclear
item.description: Microsoft, Amazon, and Google have all announced plans to partner with or build new nuclear power plants and reactors for AI. Here's why.

item.title: IBM debuts open source Granite 3.0 LLMs for enterprise AI

item.title: Investors should buy ‘dividend futures,’ Goldman Sachs says
item.description: Goldman Sachs said dividend rates currently priced into the market are well below the rates expected by analysts.
